TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content:
Pressing '.' on a boring youtube video.

When you right click on it to try and move your view around.

When I am going to drive somewhere, I remove all unnecessary stuff I have in a car, to have bigger TWR. Then I do countdown to ignition, then translate to road and then turn on SAS, RCS and throttle to 100%

-Orbital maneuvering in my sleep.

-Rocket building in my sleep.

-Thoroughly explaining the processes/why's/how's of the Apollo landing missions to my girlfriend as we watch Apollo 13.

-Figuring out my position relative to the sun and the moon while sitting outside.

I could go on forever, but mostly the things I do while falling asleep. So many orbital maneuvers in the half-asleep half-awake stage.
when you launch two rocket at the same time, without mods to help you.
Building a Jool 5 ship by DRAWING

When I'm watching a video I sometimes right-click and slide the mouse around to try to pan the camera!

JR
When you get a mental image of the propane tank behind your house while on the phone with the propane company, and this causes you to order a refill of monopropellant instead of propane

When you get a mental image of the propane tank behind your house while on the phone with the propane company, and this causes you to order a refill of monopropellant instead of propane

Nailed it

Blearily waking up at 3AM to the sound of the toddler crying and moving around, and thinking:

"Unstable, must have exhausted his batteries for SAS..."
Riding on the train, can't stop thinking "Engine ignition in T minus 3, 2, 1, ignite" and doing it multiple times on multiple stations until I get off.

Riding on the train, can't stop thinking "Engine ignition in T minus 3, 2, 1, ignite" and doing it multiple times on multiple stations until I get off.

T-Minus 5 seconds.

"Please stand back from the doors."

4, 3, 2, 1,

Doors sealed and.. Ignition! MTR has cleared the station!
That's exactly what I do...Except I replace it with "Airlock sealing"..I need to play less.
When you try to calculate the amount of delta-v in the average sneeze.
When you have a dream about your mom being told she needs a bone scan, and your brain Immediately finds a spot on the fuselage to mount that scanner.

When you right click on it to try and move your view around.

Lol! I do that all the time and get really pissed that I cant do it. Also, even Peppa Pig (I watch it with my 3 year old granddaughter, honestly) makes me think of KSP because Daddy Pigs method of making a rocket is all wrong.......
Uhmmm real life... great mod! I should install it .
You know you are playing too much when you make 50 versions of a fully functional Thunder bird 2...

When you have a Kerbal Space Imgur album that looks like this...

Javascript is disabled. View full album

JR

When you have a Kerbal Space Imgur album that looks like this...

http://imgur.com/a/IxZdi

JR

Dat last pic... Jebadiah says get tested...

When you have a Kerbal Space Imgur album that looks like this...

http://imgur.com/a/IxZdi

JR

Woah what are those bodies from?

http://i.imgur.com/YcD2IGz.png

Woah what are those bodies from?

Like the thread says... I play this game way too much! LOL

JR

When you accidentally leave hand jotted notes around work with "cryo-tug version 1" and crummy sketches of new lander designs and orbiter configurations. it would look like something a little kid would draw except for the tiny scrawlings of estimated delta-v, weight, and mass centers..

And when you have watched From Earth to the Moon about fifty times because it's the only space show that doesn't make you scream at the television "NOOOO YOU GOT IT WRONG"

Like the thread says... I play this game way too much! LOL

JR

So... where are those bodies from?
I just noticed the word "Shift" has worn off my shift key, and my spacebar has a thumb shaped groove worn into it.

I was out last night with some friends watching for the ISS to pass overhead and someone asked me how high its orbit was. I didn't know off the top of my head so I started guessing an answer by saying, "Well, the atmosphere ends at 70km...er, I mean a hundred."

Then people started pointing at various fixed celestial objects asking if they were the station, and I mocked them.
